com.tinmegali.security.mcipher

Class MEncryptorDefault

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinmegali.security.mcipher.MEncryptorDefault
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MEncryptor

    public class MEncryptorDefault
extends java.lang.Object
implements MEncryptor
    Encrypt data using native Android libraries. Compatible with SDK 19+. The encryption process will adapt itself to the current SDK. For SDK previous to 23, it will use by default the "RSA" algorithm to create a asymmetric key with a KeyPair, composed by a PrivateKey and a PublicKey, and a Certificate. It will also create a 'wrapper' Cipher when encryptData data bigger than 245 bytes. On SDK 23+, it uses the "AES" algorithm to create a symmetric key SecretKey by default and doesn't need to rely on 'wrapper' Cipher to encrypt data bigger than 245 bytes. Use the class builder MEncryptorBuilder to instantiate and configure a MEncryptor object.

      • encrypt

        public byte[] encrypt(byte[] dataToEncrypt,
                      android.content.Context context)
               throws MEncryptorException
        Encrypts a given byte array, returning a encrypted byte array. It calls a encryptLargeData(byte[], Context) for big chunks of data. For smaller chunks of data the encryption is done by the encryptData(byte[], Cipher) method.
        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface MEncryptor
        Parameters:
        dataToEncrypt - byte array to be encrypted.
        context - the context must only be passed when the method is called from SDK previous to 23.
        Returns:
        a encrypted byte array.
        Throws:
        MEncryptorException
        See Also:
        encryptData(byte[], Cipher), encryptLargeData(byte[], Context)

      • encryptData

        protected byte[] encryptData(byte[] toEncrypt,
                             javax.crypto.Cipher cipher)
                      throws java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException,
                             java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                             java.security.KeyStoreException,
                             java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                             javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                             java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                             java.security.SignatureException,
                             javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                             javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        Encrypt a given byte array using the given Cipher, returning an serialized byte array of a MEncryptedObject. The serialization process is done using MEncryptedObject.serializeEncryptedObj(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        toEncrypt - The data to encrypt. It must use a charset UTF-8.
        cipher - The correct Cipher for the encryption process. The cipher must be initialized correctly, taking into consideration the current API and chosen operations.
        Returns:
        A serialized MEncryptedObject, containing the necessary information for a future description: The IV vector
        Throws:
        java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.security.SignatureException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        See Also:
        MEncryptedObject.serializeEncryptedObj(byte[], byte[])

      • cipherForEncrypt

        protected javax.crypto.Cipher cipherForEncrypt(java.lang.String alias,
                                               android.content.Context context)
                                        throws MEncryptorException
        Initialize and return a Cipher appropriate for the current SDK. The Cipher will use different transformations, according to the SDK. By default, for API 23+, the 'AES/GCM/NoPadding' and for APIs between 18 and 22, 'RSA/ECB/PKCS1Padding'. The Cipher also will be initialized with a KeyPair or SecretKey, according to the current Android SDK: KeyPair for API 18 < 23 and SecretKey for API 23+.
        Parameters:
        alias - a unique identifies that is or will be tight to a KeyPairGenerator or KeyGenerator
        context - current Context. It is only used for calls on API previous to 23.
        Returns:
        A Cipher appropriate only for encryption operations.
        Throws:
        MEncryptorException
        See Also:
        getSecretKey(String), getKeyPair(String, Context)

      • getSecretKey

        protected javax.crypto.SecretKey getSecretKey(java.lang.String alias)
                                       throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                              java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                              java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                              java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                              java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException
        Tries to recover a SecretKey from the KeyStore using the given 'alias'. If a SecretKey is not found, it calls the generateSecretKey(String), that generates and returns the SecretKey.
        Parameters:
        alias - unique identifier used to store the SecretKey.
        Returns:
        the SecretKey associated with the give 'alias'
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException
        See Also:
        generateSecretKey(String)

      • generateSecretKey

        protected javax.crypto.SecretKey generateSecretKey(java.lang.String alias)
                                            throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                   java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                                   java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                   java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                                   java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException
        Generates a SecretKey for the given 'alias'. The 'alias' is an unique identifier that will be used to store the key in the KeyStore. By default, the KeyGenerator will use the 'AES' algorithm with 'AndroidKeyStore' provider. To be used only with Android 23+.
        Parameters:
        alias - an unique identifier that is(or will be) tight to a KeyGenerator.
        Returns:
        A symmetric key. SecretKey
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException

      • getKeyPair

        protected java.security.KeyPair getKeyPair(java.lang.String alias,
                                           android.content.Context context)
                                    throws java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException,
                                           java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                           java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                           java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                           java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Tries to recover a KeyPair from the KeyStore with the given 'alias'. If there isn't such KeyPair, it calls generateKeyPair(String, Context), returning the generated KeyPair.
        Parameters:
        alias - an unique identifies that is or will be tight to the KeyPair
        context - the current Context
        Returns:
        a valid KeyPair
        Throws:
        java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        See Also:

      • generateKeyPair

        protected java.security.KeyPair generateKeyPair(java.lang.String alias,
                                                android.content.Context context)
                                         throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                                java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Generates a KeyPair with the given 'alias'. The 'alias' is an unique identifier that is(or will be) tight to a KeyPairGenerator. By default, the KeyPairGenerator will use the 'RSA' algorithm and the 'AndroidKeyStore' provider. Also, the Certificate used is a mocked one, valid until CERTIFICATE_END_DATE. To be used only with Android 18 till 22.
        Parameters:
        alias - An unique identifier that is(or will be) tight to a KeyPairGenerator
        context - Current Context
        Returns:
        A asymmetric key. KeyPair containing a 'public' and a 'secret' key
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException

      • cipherLargeData

        protected javax.crypto.Cipher cipherLargeData(java.lang.String alias,
                                              android.content.Context context,
                                              byte[] iv)
                                       throws javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                              java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                              java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException,
                                              java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                              java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                              java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                              javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                              java.io.IOException,
                                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Generate a Cipher to be used with the in the encryption of large chunks of data, when called from SDK < 23. By default it uses the 'BouncyCastle' provider to obtain a SecretKey , using the 'AES/GCM/NoPadding' transformation, to obtain a Cipher responsible to encrypt the large data. The key is generated and the key itself is encrypted using the standard KeyPair and saved in the SharedPreferences for a later use.
        Parameters:
        alias - unique identifier tight to secret key.
        context - current Context.
        Returns:
        a Cipher using MCipherConstants.TRANSFORMATION_BC as its transformation and set to ENCRYPT_MODE.
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        See Also:
        getLargeSecretKey(String, Context)

      • getLargeSecretKey

        protected javax.crypto.SecretKey getLargeSecretKey(java.lang.String alias,
                                                   android.content.Context context)
                                            throws javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                                   java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException,
                                                   java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                   java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                                   java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                   java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                                   java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                   javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                   java.io.IOException,
                                                   java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Load or generate a secret key responsible for the encryption process of lange chunks of data in older SDKs. By default the key is obtained using the 'BouncyCastle' provider and the 'AES/GCM/NoPadding' transformation. Once the key is generated, it is encrypted and saved in the SharedPreferences for a later use. If the key was already generated with the method generateSecretKeyForLargeOps(Context), it is loaded from the SharedPreferences by the utility method MKeyWrapper.loadWrappedLargeKey(Context, Key, String). and decrypted.
        Parameters:
        alias - unique identifier tight to the secret key.
        context - current Context.
        Returns:
        a Bouncy Castle secret key.
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        See Also:
        getKeyPair(String, Context), generateSecretKeyForLargeOps(Context), MKeyWrapper.loadWrappedLargeKey(Context, Key, String), wrapAndStoreLargeKey(Context, SecretKey)

      • generateSecretKeyForLargeOps

        protected javax.crypto.SecretKey generateSecretKeyForLargeOps(android.content.Context context)
                                                       throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                              java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                                              java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException,
                                                              java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                                              java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                              javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                                              java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                              javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        Generate a SecretKey to encrypt large chunks of data in SDKs previous to 23. By default, it uses the 'Bouncy Castle' and the 'AES' algorithm.
        Parameters:
        context - current Context
        Returns:
        a Bouncy Castle secret key.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
